page.title: 10 HOUSING 1
page.content: Most of the houses of Rowhedge are of brick and most are over 50 years old. One of the special features of some houses is the{sail loft or boat store still attached to them, and which were used to store gear from the fishing smacks and racing yachts. There are approx. 720 houses in the village, 430 privately owned and 240 Council houses. The rest are rented privately or part of housing association schemes. There are no plans at present to expand the village. In Fingringhoe most of the housing is situated around the High Park Corner. A number are old, including Thornfleet. In the last 10 years a new estate has been developed along Frere Way and the development has caused this part of the village {**************************************
